text: Tommy Lee Jones (born September 15, 1946) is an American actor and movie director. He won the Academy and the Golden Globe awards in 1993 for his role in the movie The Fugitive. ==Early life== He was born in Texas in 1946. His mother, Lucille Marie (n√©e Scott), was a police officer, school teacher, and beauty shop owner. His father, Clyde C. Jones, was an oil field worker. The two were married and divorced twice. Jones has stated that his grandmother was of Cherokee ancestry. He was raised in Midland, Texas.Waycross Journal-Herald, November 6, 1982, page 4, Google News Jones was given an athletic scholarship to go to a school in Dallas, Texas. After finishing school he worked on the oil rigs before going to Harvard University to study English. He finished university in 1969 and moved to New York to be an actor. His first role was in the Broadway play, A Patriot For Me. He had many small parts until he got the main role in the movie JFK. He won the Academy Award for the best actor in a supporting role for the movie The Fugitive. ==Other websites== * * ==References== Category:People from Midland, Texas Category:American movie actors Category:American movie directors Category:American Academy Award winning actors Category:Golden Globe Award winning actors Category:Screen Actors Guild Award winners Category:Actors from Texas Category:1946 births Category:Living people
title: Tommy Lee Jones
